results.headline: Review: ‘Little Boy’ is a Fable About Faith Versus Magical Thinking
results.summary_short: Alejandro Monteverde’s new film is set during World War II.

results.headline: Review: ‘Laugh Killer Laugh’ Works the Noir Waterfront
results.summary_short: The hard-boiled protagonist of Kamal Ahmed’s movie works for a mob boss and writes Mickey Spillane-style stories that he knows are more fact than fiction.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Laugh Killer Laugh

results.headline: Review: ‘Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck,’ a Documentary by Brett Morgen
results.summary_short: This movie about the Nirvana leader, who committed suicide in 1994, reflects years of rummaging through Cobain’s archives, with the family’s permission.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Water Diviner,’ Russell Crowe Revisits Gallipoli
results.summary_short: Mr. Crowe directed and stars in this story about an Australian farmer who journeys to Turkey years after that World War I campaign to find his three missing sons.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Water Diviner

results.headline: Review: In Courteney Cox’s ‘Just Before I Go,’ a Settling of Accounts
results.summary_short: In this directorial debut, a pet store manager decides to commit suicide, but not before confronting people who hurt him while he was growing up.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Just Before I Go

results.headline: Review: In ‘Adult Beginners,’ With Rose Byrne, Siblings Meet Stress
results.summary_short: When a man’s business venture fails, he moves in with his sister and brother-in-law.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Adult Beginners

results.headline: Review: ‘Gardeners of Eden’ Tracks the Killing of Elephants for Ivory
results.summary_short: The film interviews a poacher as well as those trying to save the elephant population in Africa.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Gardeners of Eden

results.display_title: Body and Soul - The State of the Jewish Nation
results.headline: Review: ‘Body and Soul,’ a Documentary, Looks at Jews’ Ties to the Land of Israel
results.summary_short: This film by Gloria Z. Greenfield rebuts revisionist arguments over people’s historical presence in the Middle East.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Body and Soul - The State of the Jewish Nation

results.headline: Review: ‘Because I Was a Painter,’ a Documentary About Art Made in Nazi Camps
results.summary_short: Christophe Cognet’s somber film examines works surreptitiously created by prisoners in horrific circumstances.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Parce que j'étais peintre

results.headline: Review: A ‘Kung Fu Killer’ Doesn’t Follow the Rules
results.summary_short: Teddy Chen’s martial arts movie stars Donnie Yen, who faces a furious nemesis played by Wang Baoqiang.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Kung Fu Killer

results.display_title: 24 jours, la vérité sur l'affaire Ilan Halimi
results.headline: Review: ‘24 Days,’ About a Crime That Fed a Debate About Anti-Semitism
results.summary_short: This dramatized account of the abduction and torture of a Jewish cellphone vendor in Paris conveys the tension between a family’s anguish and the cool methodology of the law.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of 24 jours, la vérité sur l'affaire Ilan Halimi

results.display_title: Don't Think I've Forgotten: Cambodia's Lost Rock and Roll
results.headline: Review: In ‘Don’t Think I’ve Forgotten,’ Cambodia’s Lost Generation of Pop Stars
results.summary_short: Musicians of a thriving pop music scene in Cambodia that was brutally stamped out by the Khmer Rouge in the 1970s reclaim their place in the global youth culture of their era.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Don't Think I've Forgotten: Cambodia's Lost Rock and Roll

results.headline: Review: ‘Emptying the Skies’ Follows the Rescue of Songbirds at Most Any Cost
results.summary_short: This documentary about bird poaching, based on a Jonathan Franzen article, is less about birds than about a heartening side to human motivation.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Emptying the Skies

results.headline: Review: ‘Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2,’ Starring Kevin James, Heads to Las Vegas
results.summary_short: Mr. James stars in this sequel about a security guard from New Jersey who heads west.

results.headline: Review: ‘Felix and Meira,’ a Portrait of a Tempted Hasidic Wife
results.summary_short: Longing to feel alive, a restless young woman is drawn to someone from a different world in this film directed by Maxime Giroux.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Félix et Meira

results.headline: Review: ‘Unfriended,’ in the Scariest Ways You Can Think Of
results.summary_short: A horror movie with a touch of classic Val Lewton, but tailored to your electronic device, partly shot on GoPro and organized into computer windows.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Unfriended

results.headline: Review: ‘True Story’ Stars Jonah Hill and James Franco
results.summary_short: Rupert Goold’s film adaptation of a book by the discredited journalist Michael Finkel focuses on his wary friendship with a man charged with murder who had impersonated him.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of True Story

results.headline: Review: ‘Tangerines’ Is a Tale of War and Honor
results.summary_short: Set in the former Soviet Republic of Georgia during the 1992 war in the Abkhazia region, the film has the economy of a short story, unfolding in a mood of slightly sentimental masculine stoicism.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mandariinid

results.display_title: Salad Days: A Decade of Punk in Washington, DC (1980-90)
results.headline: Review: ‘Salad Days’ Revisits Washington’s Punk Moment
results.summary_short: The documentary explores the vigorous underground music scene of the 1980s, focusing on figures like Ian MacKaye.

results.headline: Review: ‘Monkey Kingdom’ Invests a Wild Chimp With Girl Power
results.summary_short: This Disneynature film examines a band of toque macaque monkeys in Sri Lanka, likening their caste system to a human pecking order.
